column4: hey guys when i am running ubuntu server and my spt-get is broke i tried replacing the sources.list but got the same error
broke?  What does broke consist of?
it doesnt work it says the dependencies are missing
what are you installing?
and which packages have unmet dependencies?
any of them including apt-get update :(
That last sentence doesn't make any sense, honestly.  So, what you're saying is any package you try and install has unmet dependencies?  Arlight.  Pastebin your sources.list
whats the pastebin url
here is my sources.list http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/8876
hmm.  all looks in order there.  `sudo apt-get update` doesn't fix the issue?  do you get any errrs doing that?
I get an error when i apt-get update heres the error i get http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/8879
you need to use sudo.  `sudo apt-get update`
I got the same error
Looks like you're having network problems.  Change your mirror.
I have this file called sources.list.lock and it has a number on it could that have something to do with it?
I ahv a file called sources.list.lock with a number on it could that be the problem it's in the same dir as sources.list?
ARe you editing your sources.list soemwhere?  Maybe the software properties dialog or whatnot?
it was when i made the list
did you exit out of it?
yes
would editing my /ect/hosts file ahve to do with why apt-get isn't working?
No.  Uness you made that (de.archive.ubuntu.com) URL not work.  Just change your mirror, it should work.  (remove the de, juts archive.ubuntu.com), or find one that you can ping regularly
